Accuracy.description: The degree to which the correct answer or appropriate solution is provided by the agent.

accepted_values.Correct: The answer provided is accurate and complete.
accepted_values.Partial: The answer provided is only partially correct or incomplete.
accepted_values.Incorrect: The answer provided is incorrect or not relevant.

Completeness.description: The degree to which the response covers all aspects of the task requirements.

accepted_values.Complete: The provided solution addresses all required steps and aspects of the task.
accepted_values.Incomplete: Some required steps or aspects of the task are missing in the provided solution.

Reasoning Traceability.description: The ability to follow the multi-agent system's reasoning process leading to the answer.

accepted_values.Clear: The reasoning process is transparent and easy to follow.
accepted_values.Vague: The reasoning process is present but not clear or difficult to follow.
accepted_values.Absent: The reasoning process is not provided or is not traceable.

Efficiency.description: The number of steps taken to arrive at the solution and the resources used.

accepted_values.Optimal: The minimum number of steps and resources were used to arrive at the correct solution.
accepted_values.Above Average: A moderate number of steps and resources were used to arrive at the correct solution.
accepted_values.Excessive: An excessive number of steps and resources were used, or the task was not completed efficiently.

Robustness.description: The system's ability to handle different types of questions and unforeseen issues.

accepted_values.High: The system handles a wide variety of questions and issues effectively.
accepted_values.Moderate: The system handles some questions and issues effectively, but struggles with others.
accepted_values.Low: The system has difficulty handling different types of questions and issues.

Data Contamination Prevention.description: The system's ability to avoid using contaminated data (e.g., directly lifted from the internet when not allowed).

accepted_values.Secure: No evidence of data contamination; all responses are generated independently.
accepted_values.Risky: Some responses may suggest data contamination.
accepted_values.Contaminated: Clear evidence of data contamination in the responses.
